      • addPlace

        public void addPlace(java.lang.String label)
              throws mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement
        Adds a new Place to the Petri network with the specified label.

        This method creates a new Place object and inserts it into the network, using the given label as the unique identifier. If a Place with the same label already exists, an exception is thrown to prevent duplicate entries.

        Specified by:
        addPlace in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier for the Place to be added.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement - If a Place with the specified label already exists in the network.

      • addPlace

        public void addPlace(java.lang.String label,
                     java.lang.Integer tokens)
              throws mapd.exceptions.InvalidTokenNumber,
                     mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement
        Specified by:
        addPlace in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.InvalidTokenNumber
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement

      • rmPlace

        public void rmPlace(java.lang.String label)
             throws mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Adds a new Place to the Petri network with the specified label and initial number of tokens.

        This method creates a new Place object with a given number of tokens and inserts it into the network, using the provided label as the unique identifier. If a Place with the same label already exists, an exception is thrown. Additionally, if the number of tokens is invalid (e.g., negative), an exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        rmPlace in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier for the Place to be added.
        tokens - The initial number of tokens in the Place. Must be a valid non-negative integer.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        mapd.exceptions.InvalidTokenNumber - If the provided number of tokens is invalid (e.g., negative).
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement - If a Place with the specified label already exists in the network.

      • setPlaceTokens

        public void setPlaceTokens(java.lang.String label,
                           java.lang.Integer tokens)
                    throws mapd.exceptions.InvalidTokenNumber,
                           mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Sets the number of tokens for a specified Place in the Petri network.

        This method updates the token count for the Place identified by the given label. If the label corresponds to a Place in the network, the number of tokens is updated. If the provided token count is invalid (e.g., negative), an exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        setPlaceTokens in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier of the Place whose token count is to be updated.
        tokens - The new token count for the Place. Must be a valid non-negative integer.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.InvalidTokenNumber - If the provided number of tokens is invalid (e.g., negative).
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(java.lang.String label)
                   throws mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement
        Adds a new Transition to the Petri network with the specified label.

        This method creates a new Transition object and inserts it into the network, using the given label as the unique identifier. If a Transition with the same label already exists, an exception is thrown to prevent duplicate entries.

        Specified by:
        addTransition in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier for the Transition to be added.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement - If a Transition with the specified label already exists in the network.

      • rmTransition

        public void rmTransition(java.lang.String label)
                  throws mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Removes a Transition from the Petri network with the specified label.

        This method removes the Transition identified by the given label from the network. If the label does not exist, no action is taken.

        Specified by:
        rmTransition in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier of the Transition to be removed.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • addArc

        public void addArc(java.lang.String label,
                   java.lang.String transitionLabel,
                   java.lang.String placeLabel,
                   java.lang.String type,
                   java.lang.Integer weight)
            throws mapd.exceptions.InvalidWeightNumber,
                   mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement,
                   mapd.exceptions.RepeatedArc,
                   mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Adds a new Arc to the Petri network, linking a specified Transition and Place.

        This method creates an Arc of the given type between the specified Transition and Place, using the provided label as a unique identifier. The weight of the Arc can be customized, and if no weight is provided, a default weight of 1 is used. The method checks for duplicate arcs with the same direction (Transition to Place) to avoid conflicts. If a duplicate arc or an arc with the same label already exists, an exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        addArc in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier for the Arc to be added.
        transitionLabel - The label of the Transition to which the Arc will be connected.
        placeLabel - The label of the Place to which the Arc will be connected.
        type - The type of the Arc (e.g., "in", "out", "outzero", "outbouncer").
        weight - The weight of the Arc. If null, the default weight of 1 is used.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.InvalidWeightNumber - If the provided weight is invalid (e.g., negative).
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement - If an Arc with the same label already exists in the network.
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedArc - If an Arc with the same transition, place, and type already exists.
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • addArc

        public void addArc(java.lang.String label,
                   java.lang.String transitionLabel,
                   java.lang.String placeLabel,
                   java.lang.String type)
            throws mapd.exceptions.InvalidWeightNumber,
                   mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement,
                   mapd.exceptions.RepeatedArc,
                   mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Specified by:
        addArc in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.InvalidWeightNumber
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedArc
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • setArcWeight

        public void setArcWeight(java.lang.String label,
                         java.lang.Integer weight)
                  throws mapd.exceptions.InvalidWeightNumber,
                         mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Sets the weight of a specified Arc in the Petri network.

        This method updates the weight of the Arc identified by the given label. If the provided weight is invalid (e.g., negative), an exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        setArcWeight in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier of the Arc whose weight is to be updated.
        weight - The new weight for the Arc. Must be a valid non-negative integer.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.InvalidWeightNumber - If the provided weight is invalid (e.g., negative).
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • rmArc

        public void rmArc(java.lang.String label)
           throws mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Removes an Arc from the Petri network with the specified label.

        This method deletes the Arc identified by the given label from the network. If the label does not exist, no action is taken.

        Specified by:
        rmArc in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier of the Arc to be removed.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • fireableTransitions

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> fireableTransitions()
        Retrieves a list of fireable transitions in the Petri network.

        This method checks all transitions in the network and filters those that are fireable. The keys (labels) of the fireable transitions are collected into a list, which is then returned. Additionally, the list of fireable transitions is printed to the console for debugging purposes.

        Specified by:
        fireableTransitions in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Returns:
        A list of labels of transitions that are currently fireable.

      • fire

        public void fire(java.lang.String label)
          throws mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Fires the transition identified by the specified label in the Petri network.

        This method executes the firing action for the specified transition, which may update the state of the network. The method prints the state of the places before and after firing the transition for debugging purposes.

        Specified by:
        fire in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        label - The unique identifier of the transition to be fired.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists

      • showPlaces

        public void showPlaces()
        Displays the current state of the places in the Petri network.

        This method retrieves and prints the list of places, allowing users to see the current configuration of the network. It is an overridden method that provides a specific implementation for showing places.

        Specified by:
        showPlaces in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork

      • showTransitions

        public void showTransitions()
        Displays the current state of the transitions in the Petri network.

        This method retrieves and prints the list of transitions, allowing users to see the current configuration of the network. It is an overridden method that provides a specific implementation for showing transitions.

        Specified by:
        showTransitions in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork

      • showArcs

        public void showArcs()
        Displays the current state of the arcs in the Petri network.

        This method retrieves and prints the list of arcs, allowing users to see the current configuration of the network. It provides an overview of how the transitions and places are interconnected through arcs.

        Specified by:
        showArcs in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork

      • showAllElements

        public void showAllElements()
        Displays the current state of all elements in the Petri network.

        This method prints the lists of places, transitions, and arcs in the network. It provides a comprehensive overview of the network's structure, making it easier for users to understand the current configuration and relationships between elements.

        Specified by:
        showAllElements in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork

      • renamePlace

        public void renamePlace(java.lang.String oldName,
                        java.lang.String newName)
                 throws mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement,
                        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Renames a Place in the Petri network from the old name to the new name.

        This method retrieves the Place associated with the old name, removes it from the network, and then adds it back with the new name. This effectively changes the identifier of the Place while maintaining its properties.

        Specified by:
        renamePlace in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        oldName - The current name of the Place to be renamed.
        newName - The new name to assign to the Place.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a Place with the new name already exists in the network.

      • renameTransition

        public void renameTransition(java.lang.String oldName,
                             java.lang.String newName)
                      throws mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement,
                             mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        Renames a Transition in the Petri network from the old name to the new name.

        This method retrieves the Transition associated with the old name, removes it from the network, and then adds it back with the new name. This effectively changes the identifier of the Transition while maintaining its properties.

        Specified by:
        renameTransition in interface mapd.interfaces.IPetriNetwork
        Parameters:
        oldName - The current name of the Transition to be renamed.
        newName - The new name to assign to the Transition.
        Throws:
        mapd.exceptions.RepeatedNameElement
        mapd.exceptions.ElementNameNotExists
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a Transition with the new name already exists in the network.

        Renames an Arc in the Petri network from the old name to the new name.
